title: AidExchange
description: AidExchange is here to help you help others (and yourself!) by providing a platform to request donations from your community and find requests that are near you. Our main focus is on Mutual Aid organizations and non-profits, but we also support individuals looking to reduce their spending in everyday life.
This project was done as part of a team in the UW Coding Bootcamp program.

title: Bantr
description: A social media platform, for Buzzing your Buds. Inspired by Twitter, this app utilizes a MySQL database via Sequelize to display posts made within a user's friend list.
This project was done as part of a team in the UW Coding Bootcamp program.

images.alt: A screenshot of bantr's dashboard page.
A screenshot of bantr's login page.

title: Trip Planner
description: An app for planning out a vacation! Search for restaurants and activities in one of 15 destination cities, and save them to each day of the trip. Uses localstorage to track saved data between sessions.
This project was done as part of a team in the UW Coding Bootcamp program.

images.alt: A screenshot of the Trip Planner project
A screenshot of the Trip Planner project

title: React Directory
description: An 'employee directory' built in React to demonstrate different ways to sort and filter data. It pulls a batch of random users from the Random User API to populate the 'employees' used. This list is then kept in the page's State and manipulated with sorts and filters according to user input.
This project was done solo in the UW Coding Bootcamp program.

images.alt: A screenshot of the React Directory project

title: Employee Database
description: A command-line Node app to manage a SQL database of employees. The database itself is designed to hold the employee's name, role, department, salary, and manager. To keep this information straight, it is split into 3 tables which are cross-referenced by MySQL.
This project was done solo in the UW Coding Bootcamp program.

images.alt: A screenshot of the Employee Database project

title: BurgerBase
description: A hamburger-themed checklist app, designed with MySQL, Express, and Handlebars. Users input burgers they plan to eat, then can mark them devoured and clean up after with a seamless experience and persistence across devices.

For an extra bit of fun, I added images for different kinds of burgers that are randomly selected on user input. The app also recognizes anything with 'chicken' or 'fish' in the name to provide different images that match them.
This project was done solo in the UW Coding Bootcamp program.
